definitions.definition: large in amount, value or importance

examples.text: Substantial numbers of people support the reforms.
There are substantial differences between the two groups.
Their share of the software market is substantial.
We were able to see a substantial improvement.
a street of substantial Victorian villas

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French substantiel or Christian Latin substantialis, from substantia ‘being, essence’, from substant- ‘standing firm’, from the verb substare.
